tr.td: if not empty, build records are only kept up to this number of days

Max # of builds to keep with artifacts
if not empty, only up to this number of builds have their artifacts retained

select.option: Use 'svn update' as much as possible
Use svn update as much as possible, with 'svn revert' before update
Emulate clean checkout by first deleting unversioned/ignored files, then 'svn update'
Clean checkout folders and then checkout

tr.td: Use 'svn update' whenever possible, making the build faster. But this causes the artifacts from the previous build to remain when a new build starts.
Do 'svn revert' before doing 'svn update'. This slows down builds a bit, but this prevents files from getting modified by builds.

Hudson will first remove all the unversioned/modified files/directories, as well as files/directories ignored by "svn:ignore", then execute "svn update". This emulates the fresh check out behaviour without the cost of full checkout.
Delete everything first, then perform "svn checkout". While this takes time to execute, it ensures that the workspace is in the pristine state.
Delete everything first, then perform "svn checkout". While this takes time to execute, it ensures that the workspace is in the pristine state.

the workspace root

Whitespace-separated list of recipient addresses. May reference build parameters like
$PARAM
. E-mail will be sent when a build fails, becomes unstable or returns to stable.
